bow: be careful what tv shows you choose for your toddler my year old is having behavioral issues hitting his friends and dad and several tantrums day we re working on them and seriously hoping we re able to remedy it because it taking major emotional toll on us he only watches tv on sundays and saw that several daniel tiger episodes talk about managing your temper and using your words if you haven seen an episode it typically goes like the main character daniel is upset because he isn getting what he wants and an adult explains to him why it better to use your words now when daniel is upset he growls and of course this week my toddler has started growling when he gets upset he even says growling because am mad like daniel tiger growls when he mad as of now there is little to no inclination towards also use his words like daniel does well with his age think about it as he is using his words he trying to express he upset but maybe doesn know how to detail it further than that that where he needs help used to sit down with my daughter and ask her questions and once had decent idea of what was going on inside give her my conclusion about her frustration and ask if understanding appropriately then tell her repeat after me and give her an easy age appropriate way to try and express those feelings in the future takes time but little by little they start using those skills it better than hitting so baby steps ♥️ that great point his daycare teachers and us are working very hard on getting him to use his words *instead* of hitting he usually hits and then when he asked why he tells us the reason he also knows the whole we don hit anyone script by heart and would recite it unprompted at bedtime and on the way to daycare in the mornings we re waiting for him to learn to implement them when we re not around the problem is that he hits and growls tells us why he hitting we re hoping he slowly transitions to only using his words and stops hitting 🤞🏻 we had the exact same issue with daniel tiger my son only ever mimicked the bad behavior that daniel did in the beginning he grrred for months after only watching episodes if you want the lessons would highly recommend watching mister rogers neighborhood you can get free episodes on amazon prime my son loves mister rogers and it very calming thank you for that recommendation have heard about mister rogers neighborhood but haven checked it out ll find it on amazon would prefer growling to hitting it moving towards the articulation you re looking for keep on with daniel tiger it has some neat tricks to redirect anger and frustration in physical way stomping feet when talking about it is enough would definitely avoid peppa pig though it encourages tantrums like nothing else my kids have ever watched oh missed thst part sending you luck and hugs you may notice some similarities between the two as daniel tiger is the modern spinoff of mr rogers but mr rogers is super calm know he had whole week looking at mad feelings have looked at amazon to know what episodes are available but season 26 episodes aka episodes 1691 1695 are labeled mad feelings or what to do with the mad you feel he would typically take topic and do week of episodes about it building on each other if you want and find them you can watch them yourself before showing your kiddo would also advise watching with him so you can talk about it growling because mad is using his works it also legit expression of anger too little to have full deep conversations about their feelings you still have to help ve only had issues with max and ruby so far max acts like brat daughter copies uhm excuse me but growling is actually using his words *especially* when he is able to explain that that what he doing give lot of positive attention to that and engage him in discussion gradually the growling will go away and you ll be left with child inclined to talk about his feelings when my son was around that age his thing is he would say and sometimes even yell want to hit you so hard right now or something along those lines while not optimal to us it was actually very good thing because he was hitting he was saying he felt like hitting that was amazing so we said thank you for telling us how angry you are and for not hitting let solve the problem what if he had safe space bunch of pillows specifically for hitting like couch throw pillows not ones used for something functional like sleeping he could hit when he upset you can direct him to them in times of elevation he can vent his anger physically and appropriately and then still verbalize what wrong and what to do next it just strategy we use in preschool so daniel tiger has an episode where he use your words there song and everything there some episodes for how if your mad stomp three times and make yourself feel better that teaches him to calm himself down self soothe it actually really great program we use this feelings poster https www amazon com gp product b0147i4ihg ref=ppx yo dt search asin title ie=utf8 amp psc=1 whenever kiddo is upset like when yours growls to indicate he has big feelings refer to the feelings poster to name the feeling the more he can name his feelings the more power he will have over them right now he just has feeling and does know what to call it or how to express it next work on expressing the feelings give him reasonable outlets for those feelings if he mad or sad he can say need hug or need to be alone for min or need to go outside and get some sunshine or need to snuggle my dog if he happy he can jump for joy make happy scream call family member to tell them his happy feeling etc ve learned lot about my ability to name feelings too turns out there whole spectrum beyond frustrated also do be surprised that daycare doesnt share with you how other kids hit too my 3yo daughter watxhes tv all the time and went throigh something little similar found out through the grapevine there are little boys in her class who are bad bad bad bad and the moms have all been tols but nothing has changed witnessed it finally myself when dropping her off those teachers are underpaid and usually too many kids to watch and nurture at once good luck hard work is hard but it will pay off this my 4yo turned into straight a**hole when she discovered caillou on tht pbs app like exact mirror of that little turd well growling gt hitting so maybe still win too think daniel tiger is great program especially compared to what else is out there perhaps it just me but actually like that daniel is upset in this particular episode my son and literally just watched it lol when daniel is upset and growling my son identifies that he is upset and tells me that he can see daniel is upset and then we talk about how he then used his words to explain how what he feeling and then others can help make it better if daniel never expressed frustration think the lesson would be lost difference of opinion perhaps not with you with op my son has also started growling when he upset and we can typically turn it into silly moment where ask him if he growling at me and playfully growl back and he calms down and we talk about what frustrating him used to teach preschool specially worked with at risk kiddos who all had much harder time using their words the best thing ever did was teach them stop in sign language because it not wrong to use non verbal communication but it important not to hurt people doing it my kids were able to get firm physical point across without ever touching the other child maybe that could be worth shot it takes them bit to learn it but it does work for some kiddos ve also heard caillou is terrible for this reason there also the one that tells you to stop yourself from hitting or pushing stop stop stop it ok to feel angry it not not not ok to hurt someone sing that one lot partly because it catchy lol op ve found what works for us is exaggerating that an action hurts someone else and also identifying emotions we first taught our daughter what hurt means like whenever she gets hurt then applying it to others it works really well with two people because one can focus on the victim and say things like are you ok daughter hit you that must hurt do you have boo boo here let me kiss it and make it all better it helps the child observe and realize that other people feel hurt the same way that they do do it for our cats and dog if she grabs their fur or something and sometimes on dolls toys too as far as identifying emotions ask her questions describe what think she feeling to give her words to put to feelings we talk about what other people or characters on tv are feeling and why daniel tiger is feeling frustrated because of so and so we ve also practiced making and naming different emotion faces and saying things like look he crying see the tears coming out of his eyes he is sad or she has big smile she laughing she is happy and having her make the faces like show me sad face what does grumpy face look like etc ***hug*** \^ \^ how did you teach it can you elaborate have this same problem watches the babysitter episode becomes super afraid of parents leaving watches the doctor episode becomes terrified of the doctor we love tumble leaf on amazon yes exactly we have actually seen all of the episodes even subscribed to pbs to get more lol sing his songs daily to my kids hate that little tiger he so whiny and my year old also mimics his behavior we do allow that show anymore sure when would notice conflict start would remind them to use their words to say stop would sign it every time did this would also do it myself when had conflict as an example to them please stop saying my name over and over and wait for me to finish talking to adult ll be ready to talk to you in just minute ok and sign stop when say it got to the point where could sign it across the room when kids fought and they would calm down or use it between them theres also book called hands arent for hitting if you have local children librarian ask them for suggestions of books to help deal with it they will know and be able to help you find more things along these lines my year old was doing weird angry noise for awhile like totally unacceptable growl around the house he started getting time out if he was making the bad sound then after the three minutes and he had calmed down we would talk about why he was growling similar thing when he was hitting before he learned to stop one hit was instant one minute time out the hitting stops within week after that strategy and glad to say we haven heard him make his bad sound in months also hate to be the person to say it but have you tried watching supernanny for tips that shit changed my life we had the exact same problem with this show one episode they even suggested stomping when you re mad nope this is fantastic thank you love to find ways to set little ones up to succeed socially this sounds like fantastic way for them to communicate even when they feel overwhelmed why seems like good coping behavior to me oh thank you that very kind yeah it did really help some of my super troubled littles plan on teaching it to my son when he born conflict resolution skills are so important tumble leaf is awesome and the song is super catchy as well got some books for my toddler that think have been helpful and use the titles as reminders for behavior hands are not for hitting feet are not for kicking and voices are not for yelling he likes to read them too when you feel so mad that you want to roar take deep breath and count to get him show where they actually use words or you can ban that show and take politeness teaching into your own hands just like before tv was invented we stopped watching peppa because of similar issues ive heard sign language helps with communication sounds like the boys are making bad choices vs being bad kids daniel tiger has been amazing for us my picky eater suddenly started eating spinach fish bell pepper etc because of the trying new food episode just want to say we are in the same situation with my son knows he shouldn hit does it anyway various times throughout the day at preschool and it looks extra bad because one of the teachers at his school in fact he in my class so feel ya there song that comes from the episode use your words use your words maybe watch the episode with him few more times repeat the song with him establish what words to say when he feels like growling etc we use pete the cat bite rule but it only works if we reinforce it in context remember pete the cat says bite rule let try the bites do you like it yes okay or no okay then we rewatch the episode and point out the parts we want her to retain there later episode with the song stop stop stop it okay to be angry it not not not okay to hurt someone some kiddos have tough time with hitting my year old son is the sweetest most tender hearted kid in the world and we still have problems with him hitting and even occasional biting there have been slow steady improvements his whole life but sometimes he still does it hang in there it just tougher for some kids than others and it hard on us too don know why people choose daniel when we have easy access to the original mister rogers neighborhood it is far superior and the absolute best show for little ones it kinda hit and miss what message they get from daniel tiger my at the time year old became deathly afraid of peaches because daniel tiger was allergic the messages are good if kid is old enough to grok it now at she is much better at understanding the message off topic but have to say love your username thank you we just discovered tumbke leaf over here thank you ve been curious about that book since none of our other tactics so far have shown results think ll order the book maybe it ll do the trick yeah know for fact that they don tell us about other kids hitting him we used to get report if he was ever bit by another kid which happened few times when they were but grateful that they don tell about hitting wouldn want the whole parent body to know about our little miscreant lol our daycare teachers are really attentive and somehow manage to provide excellent one on one attention even with the huge number of kids they have to watch no idea how they do it but yeah sure certain things still get unnoticed don think the program is to blame per se just think it interesting how kids pick up things that aren really the real lesson of the show for instance he has picked up the growling when the whole reason for growling to exist in that particular episode is to tell kids not to do that but to use your words and communicate your feelings when you re upset don think we ve seen that episode about hitting ll look for it and see if it helps reinforcing the themes of the shows is great idea we do it too and his teachers do too with books and stories and he has memorized all of it but hasn yet learnt how to apply them when he upset we ll keep working on it this is amazing also love your idea of the outlets and it something we haven try yet ll start implementing them thank you thank you ll speak to his teacher and see if they can create space like that there we can definitely make one at home for him sounds like need to check out tumble leaf this made me lol ve heard that about caillou glad we never started watching it do think that show has some great positive messages currently pregnant with my second and all of the episodes where daniel helps take care of his baby sister seems to really be making my toddler excited about the baby it only that along with the positive lessons he also seems to be picking up the negative behavior hugs honestly at this point feel like if met another mom irl who was going through the same thing would give her huge hug and weep hope this phase ends soon for you and for us need to find this episode and play it on repeat every day we haven watched it yet thank you for your kind words that what makes it even harder to understand he the sweetest kindest friendliest and most empathetic kid most of the time but it so hard for him to not hit when he upset hugs to you and truly know how you feel right do sometimes wonder if it meant for slightly older kids think daniel himself is supposed to be so maybe it not really meant for toddlers at this point my son is definitely only getting half the message in some of the episodes even though he able to remember what happens in each episode honestly it sometimes hard for me to not hit when upset so get it they ll get there someday yup true adults have the ability to vent endlessly to friends and family think that pretty much the only thing that keeps us from hitting others
